title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Beer industry seeks import relaxation due to can shortage
items.summary:
- The domestic beer industry faces short-term supply problems as aluminium cans were brought under mandatory BIS certification via a Quality Control Order from April 1, 2025, sparking calls for *short-term regulatory relaxation*.
- Industry estimates a deficit of *12-13 crore units* of 500 ml cans annually (about 20% of beer sales), potentially causing a *₹1,300 crore* hit to government revenues.
- Suppliers *BALL Beverage Packaging India* and *Can-Pack India* have exhausted domestic capacity and expect no increase in supply for 6–12 months, underscoring the need for imports.

items.title: ACME to build 1.2 mt sponge iron plant with green hydrogen
items.author: Nikita Periwal, Kalpana Pathak, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- ACME Group will build a *1.2 Mt/yr sponge iron (DRI) plant* powered by **green hydrogen**, co-located with its hydrogen projects.
- It has a **10-year contract** with Vietnam’s Stavian Industrial Metal for 800,000 t of DRI/HBI, with 400,000 t more being discussed with European buyers.
- Producing 1.2 Mt of DRI/HBI would require about **30,000–50,000 t** of green hydrogen, and Europe’s CBAM from 2026 could boost demand for low-carbon steel.

items.title: Contract handset makers may lose out on incentives for outsourcing
India to remain key global wind power export hub through 2030
DRL, Zydus recall drugs in US: USFDA
items.summary: - DRL's US arm recalled 571 vials of Succinylcholine Chloride Injection after an out-of-specification stability result; a *Class II recall* initiated on Sept 26, per the *USFDA*.\n- Zydus Lifesciences recalled over 1,500 boxes of Entecavir antiviral for chronic hepatitis B; additionally, Zydus Pharmaceuticals (USA) recalled 912 and 600 bottles due to *failed impurity/degradation specifications*, with a *Class II recall* initiated Sept 24.\n- The actions reflect US regulatory focus on manufacturing quality, highlighted in the USFDA Enforcement Report affecting both firms' US subsidiaries.

items.title: Nupur Extrusion to open Haryana facility next month
items.summary:
- *Nupur Extrusion* will inaugurate a new *Sampla, Haryana* facility next month, backed by ₹20-25 crore investment and a capacity of *5,000–6,000 tonnes* annually.
- Located near *Delhi-NCR* and *Maruti Kharkhoda*, the plant taps logistics and skilled labour to generate direct and indirect jobs with scope for future expansion.
- The company also plans *skill development programs* to train local youth in modern manufacturing practices.

items.title: India unveils $77 billion hydro plan as China builds upstream dam
Hitachi expands Google Cloud AI across sectors
items.summary:
- Hitachi and Google Cloud will co-develop AI agents across energy, rail and manufacturing, boosting frontline productivity with Gemini and Gemini Enterprise. 
- The project strengthens Hitachi's OT-aligned Agent Factory platform to analyze data and address labour shortages, starting with a Customer Zero internal rollout. 
- A PoC at Hitachi Power Solutions will test AI agents inspecting equipment, with real-time video monitoring and automated reporting planned, guided by Inspire 2027.

items.title: NCLT okays Allcargo’s restructuring plan to split domestic, international operations
India-EU FTA talks make headway amid steel, auto differences
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- Negotiations for the *India–EU FTA* are advancing but remain stuck on *steel*, *automobiles*, and non-tariff barriers after the 14th round.
- **Rajesh Agrawal** joined late to push momentum, with talks on *market access*, tariff reductions, and a stronger IPR regime between the sides.
- The 23‑policy framework was revived in 2022; India–EU trade reached about *$75.85B* exports (2024–25) and *$51.45B* services (2023), showing potential but a long path to a deal.

items.title: Hinduja Renewables names Deepak Thakur MD & CEO
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Hinduja Renewables named **Deepak Thakur** as MD & CEO, effective Oct 1, 2025.
- He brings *30+ years* of experience across the renewable energy value chain with leadership roles at **Mahindra Group**, **Reliance**, **Sterling & Wilson**, **L&T**, **Honeywell**, and **Thermax**.
- He succeeds Sumit Pandey; **Shom Hinduja** says his appointment will be pivotal in building Hinduja Renewables.

items.title: Tata AutoComp at IREE 2025: rail propulsion
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Tata AutoComp will showcase its expanded railway portfolio at **IREE 2025**, including **propulsion systems**, seating, HVAC, and **lightweight composites** to boost energy efficiency and reduce operating costs.
- It has partnered with Škoda, Compin Fainsa, and Air International Thermal Systems to **localise** advanced rail tech in line with **Make in India** and *Atmanirbhar Bharat*.
- The strategy signals diversification beyond automotive by bringing imported rail technologies to India with local manufacturing and faster customer response.

items.title: Himadri bets on battery materials and speciality chemicals to drive next growth phase
Foxconn commits ₹15,000 crore investment in Tamil Nadu
items.summary: - *Foxconn* will invest ₹15,000 crore in Tamil Nadu, creating about 14,000 jobs.\n- The project will advance value-added manufacturing, R&D integration and AI-led advanced tech operations in the state.\n- Tamil Nadu’s government will provide **single-window facilitation** and other support, aiming to position TN as a global hub for electronics and advanced manufacturing.

items.title: Suunil Dabral named APAC head at Körber
items.summary:
- *Suunil Dabral* named Senior Vice-President and Regional Head – *Asia-Pacific* at **Körber Supply Chain**, with full *P&L* ownership to drive APAC expansion.
- *APAC* accounts for about ~*33%* of global GDP and is where megatrends will have the strongest impact, shaping Körber's growth strategy.
- Dabral's Indian track record with PepsiCo, Nestlé, Coca-Cola, Pfizer and Micron will be scaled across APAC through *co-innovation*, joint ventures, M&A, and automation-led WMS/WCS.

items.title: How Nestle India is building safer, smarter supply chains with AI, data and driver care
Chara Technologies raises ₹52 crore to scale rare-earth-free powertrain platform
L&T wins large grid infrastructure orders in Middle East
items.summary:
- **L&T**'s Power Transmission & Distribution arm won a set of large grid infrastructure orders in the Middle East, including a 400kV substation to connect the **UAE** and **Oman**. 
- The portfolio includes engineering, procurement and construction of the 400kV UAE substation, plus orders to build several 132kV substations across the Middle East and turnkey 380kV lines in **Saudi Arabia**. 
- The projects are expected to boost generation utilization and strengthen **grid resilience** while enabling broader **renewable energy** integration in the region.

items.title: EnerGrid eyes $500 mn fundraise for greenfield projects
items.summary:
- *EnerGrid* is eyeing around *$450–500 million* to build greenfield transmission and standalone *BESS* projects across India.
- Launched in Nov 2024 by *IndiGrid*, *BII*, and *Norfund*, the fundraising is being managed by *Avendus Capital* and *Ambit Group* with pitches to global infra funds.
- The platform aims to strengthen the grid and enable energy transition, with assets to be acquired by *IndiGrid* at pre-determined valuations after commissioning.

items.title: India to launch National Critical Mineral Stockpile to secure rare earth elements amid global supply chain concerns
Punjab’s coal plants miss biomass co-firing mandate amid supply and compliance gaps
Steelmakers brace for margin squeeze, non-ferrous sector lifts earnings on price gains
DMRC invites bids to source renewable energy annually
items.summary:
- DMRC invites bids to source 500 million units of *renewable energy* annually to power its operations.
- It seeks a **grid-connected captive generating plant** with a **battery energy storage system** under a 25-year *power purchase agreement*, to be completed within 15 months of award.
- The initiative aims to lift renewable share to over 60% of total power, possibly making DMRC the first Indian metro to run a majority on clean energy.

items.title: US threatens sanctions over global shipping carbon tax
items.summary:
- The US warns it may sanction countries that back the *Net Zero Framework*, calling it a **global carbon tax** on maritime transport.
- A joint statement by Rubio, Energy Secretary Chris Wright, and Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy warns of visa bans, blocking vessels from US ports, and other penalties on officials.
- The IMO is set to vote on NZF next week, with Washington branding it a **global carbon tax** and threatening countermeasures.

items.title: "Ground Boeing 787 aircraft for electrical checks": Federation of Indian Pilots
Prose Technologies expects 15-20% growth in 2026 on pent-up demand, to expand India team
Contract handset makers may lose out on incentives for outsourcing
Concord to raise stake in Progota India to 46.5%
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- **Concord Control Systems** will raise its stake in **Progota India** from 26% to 46.5%, deepening collaboration.
- **Kavach 4.0** and Automatic Train Protection (ATP) tech will be advanced, boosting Progota's R&D and enabling rollout across Indian Railways with Concord's manufacturing strengths.
- The transaction is expected to close within six months, expanding engagement in digital signaling and railway safety.

items.title: Fuel loading at fast breeder reactor in Kalpakkam to begin next week
Affordable Robotic and Automation posts ₹4.57 cr net profit in Q2
items.summary:
- ARAPL posted a net profit of *₹4.57 crore* in the September quarter, reversing a loss of *₹4.83 crore* a year ago. 
- Q2 revenue rose to *₹28.04 crore* (net revenue) and total income to *₹29.57 crore*, up *14%* and *20% YoY*, respectively. 
- For the half year ended *Sept 30, 2025*, total income was *₹48.43 crore* (+10% YoY) and PAT *₹0.88 crore*, with EPS *₹0.78*.

items.title: PM Modi-Qualcomm discuss India AI, chips, 6G
items.author: ETEnterpriseAI Desk
items.summary:
- PM Modi met Qualcomm CEO Cristiano R. Amon to discuss India’s *AI*, *semiconductors* development and *6G* vision, underscoring joint efforts under *IndiaAI* and the *India Semiconductor Missions*.
- Amon highlighted opportunities to build an Indian ecosystem across AI devices and sectors and reaffirmed Qualcomm’s commitment to *IndiaAI*, the *India Semiconductor Missions*, and *6G* plans.
- The talks signal a push to deepen ties with global tech leaders to accelerate digital transformation and create scalable, lasting impact for India’s tech ecosystem.

items.title: PM Modi inaugurates ₹76.5 cr milk powder plant in Indore
items.summary:
- *PM Modi* virtually inaugurated a ₹76.5 crore milk powder plant at Indore as part of a broader set of agri-dairy projects. 
- The plant, under the Indore Cooperative Milk Union, can produce about *30 metric tonnes per day* of milk powder, boosting *Madhya Pradesh*'s dairy sector. 
- Officials say *Madhya Pradesh* currently accounts for about *9%* of national milk production and aims for roughly *20%* in five years, with MSP hikes and the *Bhavantar Bhugtan Yojana* to ensure fair prices for farmers.

SpiceJet adds A340 and two 737s, plans big winter expansion
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- SpiceJet inducted an *Airbus A340* wide-body and two *Boeing 737s* (operations from Oct 10–11) to kick off a winter expansion aimed at holiday travel demand.
- The carrier will induct 20 aircraft via *damp leases* between October–November and return four grounded planes by mid‑December.
- SpiceJet says it will more than double its operational fleet and triple *ASKM* by December 2025 while adding routes and frequencies.

items.title: NTPC Green Energy signs MoU with Japan’s ENEOS for green hydrogen collaboration
India adds 25 GW renewables Apr-Sep; solar leads
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- India added a record *25 GW* of renewable capacity in April–September 2025, led by **solar**, raising its solar fleet to around *125 GW*.
- The milestone pushes non-fossil electricity capacity past *50%*, meeting targets five years early and expanding programs like PM Surya Ghar and PM-KUSUM to households and farmers.
- Officials highlight *decentralised solar*, off-grid pumps and small plants to ensure inclusive, last-mile clean energy access and bolster India’s global renewables role.

items.title: ENGIE bags 100 MW solar project in Barmer from SECI
